properties.areaDesc: Ventura County Coast; Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles
properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 1 at 3:34AM PST until March 2 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Surf building to 5 to 8 feet, highest on west facing
beaches. Dangerous rip currents are expected.

* WHERE...Ventura County Coast, Los Angeles County Coast and
Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands.

* WHEN...Until 9 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip
currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large
breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and
rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
properties.instruction:
A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and
dangerous swimming conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught
in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the
current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If
unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST MONDAY
